Let $l$ be a line tangent to the circle with center $O$ inscribed in the triangle $ABC$, and let $M, N, P$ be the points of intersection of $l$ with the sides of that triangle. At the center $O$ of the circle erect perpendiculars to the lines $OM$, $ON$, $OP$. Prove that their points of intersection with the corresponding sides of the triangle are collinear.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
